page.title: 06FARMING IN PLYMTREE
page.content: In the Plymtree area there are 21 named farms on the Ordnance Survey map. 12 of these are working farms, the rest being private dwellings only. Of these 12, 5 are dairy farms, 5 are stock cattle farms, and 2 are arable farms. One dairy farm also has a large battery chicken unit. The grain produced at the arable farms is used for animal feed and some is processed at a mill in the nearby village of Payhembury. The majority of the farms are small (under 200 acres) and are farmed by tenant farmers. They are usually family concerns, possibly employing one other person on a full time basis. At harvest times extra labour is obtained through outside contractors and through a co-operative agreement between the farms.
